title: 2006년 Exact Software North America, Inc. v. Infocon, Inc. 사건
summary: 미국 Ohio, OH 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Exact Software North America, Inc. v. Infocon, Inc.. 판결일: 2006-12-05. 법원: District Court, N.D. Ohio.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: EXACT SOFTWARE NORTH AMERICA, INC., Plaintiff v. INFOCON, INC., Defendant
**판결일**: 2006-12-05
**법원**: District Court, N.D. Ohio
**관할**: Ohio, OH

**판사**: Carr

## 변호인

Karen Kelly Grasso, Goldman & Rosen, Akron, OH, for Plaintiff., John M. Carey, Watkins, Robert W. Bohmer, Bates & Carey, Toledo, OH, J. Fox Demoisey, Demoisey Law Offices, Louisville, KY, for Defendant.

## 인용

- 479 F. Supp. 2d 702

## 판결문 요약


479 F.Supp.2d 702 (2006)
EXACT SOFTWARE NORTH AMERICA, INC., Plaintiff
v.
INFOCON, INC., Defendant.
No. 3:03CV7183.
United States District Court, N.D. Ohio, Western Division.
December 5, 2006.
*703 Karen Kelly Grasso, Goldman & Rosen, Akron, OH, for Plaintiff.
John M. Carey, Watkins, Robert W. Bohmer, Bates & Carey, Toledo, OH, J. Fox Demoisey, Demoisey Law Offices, Louisville, KY, for Defendant.

ORDER
CARR, Chief Judge.
This case began as a collection action by the plaintiff, Exact Software North America, Inc. [ESNA], against the defendant, Infocon, Inc. ESNA claimed that Infocon owed monies to ESNA that Infocon had received from its customers.
ESNA is a successor through merger to Macola, Inc., a Marion, Ohio, producer of software.
Infocon, which had been a "reseller" [i.e., distributor] of software produced by Macola, counterclaimed, alleging: 1) breach of contract; 2) fraud; and 3) intentional interference with contract.
Pending is Infocon's Motion for Entry of Default Judgement Pursuant to Fed. R.Civ.P. 37(b) [Doc. 141] as to ESNA's complaint and Infocon's counterclaims.[1] Infocon bases its motion on ESNA's persistent and protracted failures to comply with its discovery obligations and this court's orders relating to those obligations.
For the reasons that follow, I conclude that, due to ESNA's persistent and egregious noncompliance with a series of discovery orders, sanctions are fully warranted. But, as I cannot presently ascertain where the fault for that n...
